older hard drives may be detected properly by your USB adapter, never drives - 512k logical / 4k physical may be mangled to 4k logical / 4k phys.
your USB adapter is probably lying intentionally, they do it to make bigger drives than 2TB work on Windows
Both the drive 2.5" are newer
it's a trick to make 2TB+ drives accessible with msdos partition table
it's probably working fine for drives with 512k log. / 512 k phys. sector size
and it's probably lying for 512k log / 4 k phys
either connect the drive directly without the USB adapter, or buy an adapter which doesn't mangle sector sizes
